meanings.definition: To enter a social event without an invitation.
meanings.sent1: She was gatecrashing the wedding by sneaking in through the back entrance.
meanings.sent2: He gatecrashes every party in town, hoping to meet new people.
meanings.sent3: Gatecrashing the picnic, the squirrel stole all the nuts and ran away.
meanings.sent4: The storm gatecrashed the peaceful afternoon, disrupting the outdoor concert.
meanings.sent5: Gatecrashing the dance floor, she twirled and spun with joy.

meanings.definition: The act of attending a party or gathering without being invited.
meanings.sent1: Gatecrashing can sometimes lead to unexpected friendships.
meanings.sent2: The gatecrashing at the concert caused quite a commotion.
meanings.sent3: The cat became famous for gatecrashing all the neighborhood barbecues.
meanings.sent4: His laughter was like gatecrashing, filling the room with joy.
meanings.sent5: The gatecrashing of the uninvited guests made the host nervous.
